file.name: swagger.yaml
file.content: openapi: "3.0.0" info: version: 2.0.0 title: Trace API Examples description: | The Trace API Examples are a set of example scenarios showing some use cases of the IBM Blockchain Transparent Supply API. Below are some recall scenarios that allow callers to determine the impact of a recall, specifying a location where a recall is initiated from, a list of GTINs harvested at that location, and a date range for harvest. Given that information, there are endpoints to determine: * EPCs harvested * EPCs impacted (including products with harvested EPCs as ingredients) * Purchase orders and Despatch advice IDs associated with shipments of any impacted EPCs * EPCs & locations of any ingredients used in the final product(s) searched # Authorization to use the Trace API Extensions Only authorized users with a registered IBMid can make IBM Blockchain Transparent Supply™ API calls. If necessary, contact your IBM Blockchain Transparent Supply Organization Administrator for authorization to use this API. Authenticate with your registered IBMid, as follows: 1. Open the [IBM Blockchain Solution Manager](https://developer.transparentsupply.ibm.com/ift/api/identity-proxy/login) page in a new tab or window. 2. Log in with your IBMid, and if necessary, select your Organization. 3. Click **Copy** to copy the User Token. 4. Return to this page and click the green **Authorize** button on the lower right. 5. In the **Available authorizations** dialog, paste your copied User Token into the **Value** field. 6. Click **Authorize** and **Close**. You are now authorized to use this API. For subsequent sessions, repeat the steps above to obtain a new User Token. servers: - url: '/api-samples/recall-assistant/v1' paths: /harvested-epcs: get: summary: Return EPCs that we harvested with the matching criteria parameters: - $ref: '#/components/parameters/locationId' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/productIdCommissionedIngredient' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventStartTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventEndTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/output' responses: '200': description: OK /impacted-epcs: get: summary: Return EPCs that contain any of the the matching data as ingredients parameters: - $ref: '#/components/parameters/locationId' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/productIdCommissionedIngredient' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventStartTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventEndTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/output' responses: '200': description: OK /impacted-transactions: get: summary: Return transactions (POs and DAs) that contain impacted EPCs parameters: - $ref: '#/components/parameters/locationId' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/productIdCommissionedIngredient' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventStartTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventEndTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/output' responses: '200': description: OK /ingredient-sources: get: summary: Return EPCs that were used in the transformation on the searched product parameters: - $ref: '#/components/parameters/productIdFinishedGood' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventStartTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventEndTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/output' responses: '200': description: OK /product-destinations: get: summary: Return EPCs that were the results of transformations from the searched product parameters: - $ref: '#/components/parameters/productIdIngredient' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventStartTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/eventEndTimestamp' - $ref: '#/components/parameters/output' responses: '200': description: OK components: securitySchemes: bearerAuth: type: http scheme: bearer bearerFormat: JWT parameters: productIdFinishedGood: name: product_id[] in: query description: restrict results to any of the GS1 GTINs (numeric) or IBM Blockchain Transparent Supply Product Identifiers (URN) provided. maximum number of items is 30. e.g urn:ibm:ift:product:class:7055812837404.packe2_323e8524 schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/productId' productIdIngredient: name: product_id[] in: query description: restrict results to any of the GS1 GTINs (numeric) or IBM Blockchain Transparent Supply Product Identifiers (URN) provided. maximum number of items is 30. e.g urn:ibm:ift:product:class:7055812837404.grade1_323e8524 schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/productId' productIdCommissionedIngredient: name: product_id[] in: query description: restrict results to any of the GS1 GTINs (numeric) or IBM Blockchain Transparent Supply Product Identifiers (URN) provided. maximum number of items is 30. e.g urn:ibm:ift:product:class:7055812837404.flowe0_323e8524 schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/productId' locationId: name: location_id[] in: query description: restrict results to the specified GS1 GLN (numeric) or IBM Blockchain Transparent Supply Location Identifier (URN) provided. e.g. urn:ibm:ift:location:loc:7055812837404.growe0_323e8524 schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/string' eventStartTimestamp: name: event_start_timestamp in: query description: restrict results to records with an event timestamp on or after the timestamp (ISO 8601) provided, eg. 2020-10-01 schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/string' eventEndTimestamp: name: event_end_timestamp in: query description: restrict results to records with an event timestamp strictly before the timestamp (ISO 8601) provided, eg. 2020-10-03 schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/string' output: name: output in: query description: format of the output. Only "JSON" and "CSV" are provided. The default is "CSV" schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/string' schemas: productId: type: array items: type: string string: type: string security: - bearerAuth: []
